item.name: Linux: count of not installed updates

trigger.expression: {Template OS Debian public:script.linux.1.last()}=1 and {Template OS Debian public:log[/var/log/auth.log,"authentication failure",,,skip,].count(300,"authentication failure","like")}>5
trigger.name: Linux: auth.log bruteforce detected

trigger.expression: {Template OS Debian public:vfs.file.size[/var/log/auth.log].change()}<0 and ({Template OS Debian public:vfs.file.size[/var/log/auth.log].time()}>{$ROTATETIMEUP} or {Template OS Debian public:vfs.file.size[/var/log/auth.log].time()}<{$ROTATETIMEDOWN})
trigger.name: Linux: auth.log size decrease

trigger.expression: {Template OS Debian public:script.linux.numupdates.last()}>0 and {Template OS Debian public:log[/var/log/unattended-upgrades/unattended-upgrades.log,"Packages that will be upgraded: (.*)",,,skip,\1].regexp("Slovo kotororogo nikogda ne budet")}=0
trigger.name: Linux: need install updates {ITEM.VALUE1}

trigger.expression: {Template OS Debian public:script.linux.run.iregexp("error")}=1 or {Template OS Debian public:script.linux.run.regexp("Permission denied")}=1 or {Template OS Debian public:script.linux.run.regexp("^E:")}=1
trigger.name: Linux: script.linux.run contain ERROR msg

trigger.expression: {Template OS Debian public:script.linux.1.last()}=1 and {Template OS Debian public:log[/var/log/syslog,,,,skip,].count(60,"Discarding packet received","like")}>0
trigger.name: Linux: syslog - Discarding packet received

trigger.expression: {Template OS Debian public:script.linux.1.last()}=1 and ( {Template OS Debian public:log[/var/log/syslog,,,,skip,].count(60,"error","like")}>0 or {Template OS Debian public:log[/var/log/syslog,,,,skip,].count(60,"ALERT","like")}>0)
trigger.name: Linux: syslog - ERROR message detected

trigger.expression: ({Template OS Debian public:log[/var/log/syslog,,,,skip,].regexp("entered promiscuous mode")}=1 and {TRIGGER.VALUE}=0) or (not {Template OS Debian public:log[/var/log/syslog,,,,skip,].regexp("left promiscuous mode")}=1 and {TRIGGER.VALUE}=1)
trigger.name: Linux: syslog - interface in promiscuous mode

trigger.expression: {Template OS Debian public:script.linux.1.last()}=1 and {Template OS Debian public:log[/var/log/syslog,,,,skip,].count(60,"dropping packets","like")}>0
trigger.name: Linux: syslog - iptables droping packets

trigger.expression: {Template OS Debian public:script.linux.1.last()}=1 and {Template OS Debian public:log[/var/log/syslog,,,,skip,].count(60,"the NTP socket is in use","like")}>0
trigger.name: Linux: syslog - NTP misconfigured

trigger.expression: {Template OS Debian public:script.linux.1.last()}=1 and {Template OS Debian public:log[/var/log/syslog,,,,skip,].count(60,"segfault","like")}>0
trigger.name: Linux: syslog - segfault detected

trigger.expression: {Template OS Debian public:script.linux.1.last()}=1 and {Template OS Debian public:log[/var/log/syslog,,,,skip,].count(60,"Unable to connect to CUPS server","like")}>0
trigger.name: Linux: syslog - smbd printer misconfigured

trigger.expression: {Template OS Debian public:script.linux.1.last()}=1 and {Template OS Debian public:log[/var/log/syslog,,,,skip,].count(60,"WRITE SAME failed. Manually zeroing.","like")}>0
trigger.name: Linux: syslog - WRITE SAME failed. Manually zeroing.

trigger.expression: {Template OS Debian public:vfs.file.size[/var/log/syslog].change()}<0 and ({Template OS Debian public:vfs.file.size[/var/log/syslog].time()}>{$ROTATETIMEUP} or {Template OS Debian public:vfs.file.size[/var/log/syslog].time()}<{$ROTATETIMEDOWN})
trigger.name: Linux: syslog size decrease

trigger.expression: {Template OS Debian public:script.linux.1.last()}=1 and {Template OS Debian public:log[/var/log/syslog,,,,skip,].count(60,"warning","like")}>0
trigger.name: Linux: syslog WARNING message detected

trigger.expression: {Template OS Debian public:vfs.file.size[/var/log/wtmp].change()}<0 and ({Template OS Debian public:vfs.file.size[/var/log/wtmp].time()}>{$ROTATETIMEUP} or {Template OS Debian public:vfs.file.size[/var/log/wtmp].time()}<{$ROTATETIMEDOWN})
trigger.name: Linux: wtmp size decrease

graph.name: Linux: log msg count and size
